summary: The state of Texas is divided into 254 counties.
full_text: Wilbarger County is a county located in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, the population was 13,535. The county seat is Vernon. The county was created in 1858 and later organized in 1881. Wilbarger is named for Josiah Pugh Wilbarger and Mathias Wilbarger, two early settlers.
title: Wilbarger County, Texas
